sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Cholesky decomposition
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using Cholesky decomposition:  

$$
\begin{aligned}
3x+6y+9z &= 12 \\
6x+13y+20z &= 23 \\
9x+20y+36z &= 41
\end{aligned}
$$

Show all steps of the Cholesky decomposition method and give the final solution in terms of $x, y,$ and $z$.
message_2:
First, we need to write the given system of linear equations in matrix form:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
3 & 6 & 9 \\
6 & 13 & 20 \\
9 & 20 & 36
\end{bmatrix}
\begin{bmatrix}
x \\
y \\
z
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
12 \\
23 \\
41
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Now, we will perform Cholesky decomposition on the coefficient matrix. The Cholesky decomposition is a decomposition of a Hermitian, positive-definite matrix into the product of a lower triangular matrix and its conjugate transpose. In this case, we have a real symmetric positive-definite matrix, so we can decompose it into the product of a lower triangular matrix and its transpose:

$$
A = LL^T
$$

where $A$ is the coefficient matrix, $L$ is a lower triangular matrix, and $L^T$ is the transpose of $L$. We will find $L$ by solving the following equations:

$$
\begin{aligned}
l_{11}^2 &= 3 \\
l_{21}l_{11} &= 6 \\
l_{31}l_{11} &= 9 \\
l_{21}^2 + l_{22}^2 &= 13 \\
l_{31}l_{21} + l_{32}l_{22} &= 20 \\
l_{31}^2 + l_{32}^2 + l_{33}^2 &= 36
\end{aligned}
$$

Solving these equations, we get:

$$
\begin{aligned}
l_{11} &= \sqrt{3} \\
l_{21} &= 2 \\
l_{31} &= 3 \\
l_{22} &= \sqrt{1} = 1 \\
l_{32} &= 2 \\
l_{33} &= \sqrt{5}
\end{aligned}
$$

So, the lower triangular matrix $L$ is:

$$
L =
\begin{bmatrix}
\sqrt{3} & 0 & 0 \\
2 & 1 & 0 \\
3 & 2 & \sqrt{5}
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Now, we will solve the following system of linear equations:

$$
LY = B
$$

where $Y = \begin{bmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{bmatrix}$ and $B = \begin{bmatrix} 12 \\ 23 \\ 41 \end{bmatrix}$. Substituting the values of $L$ and $B$, we get:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
\sqrt{3} & 0 & 0 \\
2 & 1 & 0 \\
3 & 2 & \sqrt{5}
\end{bmatrix}
\begin{bmatrix}
x \\
y \\
z
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
12 \\
23 \\
41
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Solving this system, we get:

$$
\begin{aligned}
x &= \frac{12}{\sqrt{3}} \\
y &= 23 - 2x \\
z &= \frac{41 - 3x - 2y}{\sqrt{5}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Substituting the value of $x$ into the equation for $y$, we get:

$$
y = 23 - 2\left(\frac{12}{\sqrt{3}}\right) = 23 - \frac{24}{\sqrt{3}}
$$

Now, substituting the values of $x$ and $y$ into the equation for $z$, we get:

$$
z = \frac{41 - 3\left(\frac{12}{\sqrt{3}}\right) - 2\left(23 - \frac{24}{\sqrt{3}}\right)}{\sqrt{5}} = \frac{41 - \frac{36}{\sqrt{3}} - 46 + \frac{48}{\sqrt{3}}}{\sqrt{5}} = \frac{-5 + \frac{12}{\sqrt{3}}}{\sqrt{5}}
$$

Thus, the final solution in terms of $x, y,$ and $z$ is:

$$
\begin{aligned}
x &= \frac{12}{\sqrt{3}} \\
y &= 23 - \frac{24}{\sqrt{3}} \\
z &= \frac{-5 + \frac{12}{\sqrt{3}}}{\sqrt{5}}
\end{aligned}
$$
